result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Pence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Pence

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Request to cancel with Christina at GLSO today's date at 8:34 a.m.-sr
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

9:54 am
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned at 9:54 am
Inmate Request to the court - denied

9:33 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-10 days county jail with huber.  Court grants out of county travel and out of counsel service.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:39 a.m.
Status hearing on July 5, 2016 at 09:15 am.

8:43 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by DA - requests to look closer at the case before making an offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.  Court notes bond has been set - $500 signature bond.  Defendant to complete processing.  

Court adjourned at 8:47 a.m.
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Laura N. at GLSO.
43

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over charges and penalties.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Statement by defendant - resides at N201 36th Road  Berlin, WI  54923 - parents address, but was staying at a friends place.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Defendant to appear in court for Initial appearance on June 14, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant regarding CHIPS cases and provides defendant with copies of the notices to appear in court.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
